attributes.meaningful_name: Botnet Empresarial/Botnet Empresarial/Botnet Empresarial/MIrai para basarse/Modified Mirai/dlr/release/dlr.ppc

threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered downloader. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.

names: Botnet Empresarial/Botnet Empresarial/Botnet Empresarial/MIrai para basarse/Modified Mirai/dlr/release/dlr.ppc
attributes.magic: ELF 32-bit MSB executable, PowerPC or cisco 4500, version 1 (SYSV), statically linked, stripped

crowdsourced_ai_results.analysis: The sample is a malicious downloader associated with the Mirai botnet. It establishes a network connection to download a secondary payload (mirai.ppc) via an HTTP GET request and saves it to the local filesystem under the name 'dvrHelper'. The binary uses raw syscalls for networking (socketcall) and file I/O (open, read, write) to minimize dependencies and avoid standard library hooks. Concrete IOCs include the string 'MIRAI', the file path '/bins/mirai.ppc', and the filename 'dvrHelper'.
